intro: Neisosperma ficifolium, commonly known as the fig-leaf tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that resemble those of a fig tree. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that changes color as it matures. Neisosperma ficifolium is often grown for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique appearance.
